questions.question_text: Which of the following is a tool that runs on the Windows OS and analyzes iptables log messages to detect port scans and other suspicious traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think must be NetRanger, as PSAD works on linux OS

Selected Answer: A
Ports with numbers 0–1023 are called system or well-known ports; ports with numbers 1024-49151 are called user or registered ports, and ports with numbers 49152-65535 are called dynamic, private or ephemeral ports.

Selected Answer: A
Registered ports are in the range 1024 to 49151. Dynamic ports are in the range 49152 to 65535. most new port assignments are in the range from 1024 to 49151

but page 1760 says:
Port numbers have the following assigned ranges:  Numbers below 1024 are considered well-known port numbers.  Numbers above 1024 are dynamically assigned port numbers.  Registered port numbers are those registered for vendor-specific applications; most of these are above 1024.

B
Page 1749 CND book by EC-Council 
The well-known ports are assigned by IANA and can only be used by the system (or root) processes or by programs executed by privileged users on most systems. The registered ports are listed by IANA and can be used by ordinary user processes or programs executed by ordinary users on most systems. IANA registers the uses of these ports for convenience. The range of assigned ports managed by the IANA is 0–1023.

questions.question_text: What is the range for registered ports?

discussion.content: In the official EC-Council e-book, Page 5, it mentioned that there are 4 layers under the TCP/IP model. Kindly confirm. TY.

Selected Answer: C
EC-Council CND v2 book, page 2502, says 4 layers

Selected Answer: C
TCP/IP is a four-layered protocol developed by the Department of Defense (DOD)

correct is 4 layers

TCP/IP Layers
TCP/IP is a four-layered protocol developed by the Department of Defense (DOD). Each layer in this model performs a different function, and data flow occurs from layer 4 to 1 (from the sending machine) and from layer 1 to 4 (in the destination machine).

questions.question_text: How many layers are present in the TCP/IP model?
In which of the following transmission modes is communication uni-directional?

discussion.content:
Simlex - Communication is
unidirectional.
Half-duplex-Communication is
two-directional but,
one at a time.

Selected Answer: C
C and D are both correct.

Simplex communication is a communication channel that sends information in one direction only. The International Telecommunication Union definition is a communications channel that operates in one direction at a time, but that may be reversible; this is termed half duplex in other contexts

Selected Answer: A
CSMA/CD (Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection) is specified in the IEEE 802.3 standard, which is commonly known as Ethernet. This standard defines the physical and data link layer specifications for wired Ethernet networks, including CSMA/CD as the access method used by Ethernet to share the medium and avoid collisions between multiple devices trying to communicate on the same network segment.

questions.question_text: CSMA/CD is specified in which of the following IEEE standards?
